Research

With the goal of providing broad exposure of scholarship supporting the Cicognara Library and to enhance engagement with the collection, please explore the following bibliography related to Count Leopoldo Cicognara and the history of his collection.

In 2020, an opportunity to support English translation for two peer-reviewed academic articles was made possible by a grant from The Samuel H. Kress Foundation. These two articles are now available via JSTOR and open access through the Journal of Art Historiography providing fundamental information and analysis for those who wish to make use of Cicognara's collection.

Journal of Art Historiography

Number 26 June 2022

Studies on the Cicognara Library, Part 1 of a series: Guest edited by Jeanne-Marie Musto (New York Public Library)

Jeanne-Marie Musto, Introduction 26/JMM1

Translation: Barbara Steindl (Kunsthistorisches Institut in Florenz, Max-Planck-Institut), ‘The early years of Leopoldo Cicognara’s book collection’ 26/BS1

Translation: Barbara Steindl (Kunsthistorisches Institut in Florenz, Max-Planck-Institut), ‘Collecting art books: the library of Leopoldo Cicognara and his bibliographic system’ 26/BS2

Number 27 December 2022:

Studies on the Cicognara Library, Part 2 of a series: Guest edited by Jeanne-Marie Musto (New York Public Library)

Jeanne-Marie Musto, ‘Introduction’ 27/JM1

Elena Granuzzo (Ca’ Foscari University of Venice), ‘Leopoldo Cicognara and his library: Formation and significance of a collection (I)’ 27/EG1

Barbara Steindl (Kunsthistorisches Institut in Florenz, Max-Planck-Institut), ‘Cicognara’s views on fifteenth-century sculpture in light of his art library’ 27/BS1

Translations to be published on 1 June 2023:

PART 2: Title translated as: “Leopoldo Cicognara and his Library: Formation and Significance of a Collection.” Elena Granuzzo. "Leopoldo Cicognara e la sua Biblioteca: formazione e significato di una collezione," parts I and II. La Bibliofilía, vol. 114 (2012), pp. 231-272 and pp. 371-412.

Cicognara Bibliography

Modern Scholarship: Cicognara, art history bibliography, and historiography

Antolini, Patrizio. 1879. Notizie su Leopoldo Cicognara e sua famiglia. Ferrara: Premiata tipografia sociale.

"ARLIS/NA CAA Joint Session on Art Bibliography." ARLIS/NA Newsletter 6, no. 2 (1978): 26-26.

Arntzen, Etta, and Rainwater, Robert. A Guide to the Literature of Art History. Chicago: American Library Association, 1980.

Bassi, Elena. Venezia Nell'età Di Canova, 1780-1830: Venezia, Ala Napoleonica, Museo Correr, Ottobre-Dicembre 1978. Venezia: Alfieri, 1978.

Besterman, Theodore. Old Art Books: Collected and Catalogued by Theodore Besterman. London: Maggs Brothers, 1975.

Borenius, Tancred. "The Catalogo Cicognara." The Book-Collector's Quarterly 0, no. 5 (1932): 78. https://search.proquest.com/docview/1298877459.

C.-B, P. "Publication of the Fondo Cicognara." Museum Management and Curatorship 8, no. 3 (1989): 333-334.

Chamberlin, Mary W. A Guide to Art Reference Books. Chicago: American Library Association, 1959.

Dodds, Douglas. "Viewpoint: The Future of Art Bibliography." Art Libraries Journal 36, no. 3 (2011): 3-4.

Esposito, Enzo, Giovanni Solimine, Rino Pizzi, and Prentiss Moore. "Bibliographical Studies in Italy since 1945." Libraries & Culture 25, no. 3 (1990): 433-445.

Fabian, Carole Ann and Kathleen Salomon. "Future of Art Bibliography Initiative: Charting a New Future." Art Documentation: Journal of the Art Libraries Society of North America 31, no. 2 (2012): 176-185.

Fehl, Philipp P., Lizabeth Wilson, and Leopoldo Cicognara. The Cicognara Library: Literary Sources In the History of Art and Kindred Subjects. Urbana, Ill.: Published by the Leopoldo Cicognara Program at the University of Illinois Library in association with the Vatican Library, 1989.

Fehl, Philipp P. 1999. "Stendhal and Leopoldo Cicognara: notes on the strategy and the truth of Stendhal's lies". Gazette Des Beaux-Arts / Fondée Par Charles Blanc. 93-116.

Franklin, Jonathan. " Cataloguing the Library of Sir Charles Eastlake (1793-1865) at the Library of the National Gallery, London." Art Libraries Journal 42, no. 4 (10, 2017): 189-194.

Franklin, Jonathan. "Museum Libraries and Library History: Joining the Research Conversation at the National Gallery." Art Libraries Journal 44, no. 1 (01, 2019): 19-22. doi:http://dx.doi.org/10.1017/alj.2018.35. https://search.proquest.com/docview/2173848141.

Glover-Godlewski, Susan and Lee Sorensen. "PROFESSIONAL LITERATURE: Art Bibliographies: A Comparison of the Big Three." Art Documentation: Journal of the Art Libraries Society of North America 5, no. 4 (1986): 175-176.

Granuzzo, Elena. "Leopoldo Cicognara e La Sua Biblioteca: Formazione e Significato Di Una Collezione (I)." La Bibliofilía 114, no. 2 (2012): 231-272.

Granuzzo, Elena. "Leopoldo Cicognara e La Sua Biblioteca: Formazione e Significato Di Una Collezione (II)." La Bibliofilía 114, no. 3 (2012): 371-412.

Haskell, Francis, History and Its Images: Art and the Interpretation of the Past. New Haven: Yale University Press, 1993. (193-200)

Hatheway, Holly, Roger Lawson, and Charlotte Oertel. "The Digital chicognara Library: transforming a 19th–century resource for the digital age." Art libraries journal, no. 4, volume 5, issue 2 (2020): 47-54.

Holly, Michael Ann. Panofsky and the Foundations of Art History. Ithaca, N.Y.: Cornell University Press, 1984.

Irvine, Betty Jo and William B. Walker. "Wolfgang M. Freitag, 1924–2012: A Tribute." Art Documentation: Journal of the Art Libraries Society of North America 32, no. 2 (2013): 152-173.

Johnson, Geraldine A. "‘(Un)Richtige Aufnahme’: Renaissance Sculpture and the Visual Historiography of Art History." Art History 36, no. 1 (2013): 12-51.

La collezione di tutti i disegni originali che hanno servito per intagliare le tavole della storia della scultura di Leopoldo Cicognara" : (Vat. Lat. 13748) / Elisabetta G. Rizzioli. Rizzioli, Elisabetta. Città del Vaticano : Biblioteca apostolica vaticana, 2016.

Larsen, John C. "A Seminar in Fine Arts Bibliography." Journal of Education for Librarianship 11, no. 2 (1970): 145-147.

Magani, Fabrizio. Canova e L'accademia: Il Maestro e Gli Allievi. Treviso [Italy]: Canova, 2002.

Malamani, Vittorio. 1888. Memorie del conte Leopoldo Cicognara, tratte dai documenti originali. Venezia: I. Merlo.

Marmor, Max. "Baedeker and Art Bibliography." Art Documentation: Journal of the Art Libraries Society of North America14, no. 4 (1995): 25-26.

Mazzocca, Fernando, Paola Marini, and Roberto De Feo. Canova, Hayez e Cicognara: L'ultima Gloria Di Venezia. Prima edizione.

Picotti, 1813-18.Cicognara, Leopoldo. Le fabbriche e i monumenti cospicui di Venezia. 2 vols. Venice: G. Antonelli, 18 15-20.

Racioppi, Pier Paolo. "The Men of Letters and the Teaching Artists: Guattani, Minardi, and the Discourse on Art at the Accademia Di San Luca in Rome in the Nineteenth Century." Journal of Art Historiography no. 19 (12, 2018): 1-19. https://search.proquest.com/docview/2167787909.

Reinink, Adriaan Wessel, and Jeroen Stumpel. Memory & Oblivion: Proceedings of the XXIXth International Congress of the History of Art Held In Amsterdam, 1-7 September 1996. Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers, 1999.

Rizzioli, Elisabetta, and Leopoldo Cicognara. La collezione Di Tutti i Disegni Originali Che Hanno Servito Per Intagliare Le Tavole Della Storia Della Scultura Di Leopoldo Cicognara (vat. Lat. 13748).

Rizzioli, Elisabetta G., L'officina Di Leopoldo Cicognara: La Creazione Delle Immagini Per La Storia Della Scultura.

Salomon, Kathleen. "Facilitating Art-Historical Research in the Digital Age: The Getty Research Portal." Getty Research Journal 6, no. 1 (2014): 137-141.

Schlosser, Julius. La letteratura artistica: Manuale delle fonti della storia dell'arte moderna. Translated by Filippo Rossi. Florence: la Nuova Italia, 1964.

Sorensen, Lee R. "Art Bibliographies: A Survey of their Development, 1595-1821." The Library Quarterly: Information, Community, Policy 56, no. 1 (1986): 31-55.

Sorensen, Lee and Susan Glover-Godlewski. "PROFESSIONAL LITERATURE: Art Bibliographies: A Comparison of the Big Three Part II." Art Documentation: Journal of the Art Libraries Society of North America 6, no. 1 (1987): 35-36.

Steinitz, Kate T. "Early Art Bibliographies. Who Compiled the First Art Bibliography?" The Burlington Magazine 114, no. 837 (1972): 829-837.

Zanetti, Alessandro, and Leopoldo Cicognara. 1837. Le premier siècle de la calcographie ou catalogue raisonné des estampes du cabinet de feu M. le Comte Léopold Cicognara... Avec une appendice sur les Nielles du même cabinet. Venise: Antonelli.

Count Leopoldo Cicognara (1767-1834): Published Works

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Elogio Di Andrea Palladio... Venezia, 1811.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Dei Quattro Cavalli Riposti Sul Pronao Della Basilica Di S. Marco: Narrazione Storica. Venice: Dalla Tipografia di Alvisopoli, 1815.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Johann Joachim Winckelmann, and Jean Baptists Louis Georges Seroux d'Agincourt. Storia Della Scultura Dal Suo Risorgimento In Italia: Fino Al Secolo Di Canova Del Conte Leopoldo Cicognara. Ed. 2. riveduta ed ampliata dall'autore Prato: Frat. Giachetti, 1823.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Memorie Spettanti Alla Storia Della Calcografia Del Commend. Conte Leopoldo Cicognara. Prato: Giachetti, 1831.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Notizie Intorno Ad Antonio Fabbris Udinese Orefice, Coniatore, Intagliatore, Ec. Firenze, 1831.

Elogio Del Conte Leopoldo Cicognara. Venezia: Tipografia di Tommaso Fontana, 1846.

Memorie del conte Leopoldo Cicognara : tratte dai documenti originali...Malamani, Vittorio, 1860- Venezia : I. Merlo, 1888.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Antonio Canova, and Gianni Venturi. Lettere Ad Antonio Canova. Urbino: Argalìa, 1973.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Antonio Canova, and Paolo Mariuz. Leopoldo Cicognara Ad Antonio Canova: Lettere Inedite Della Fondazione Canova Di Possagno. Cittadella (PD) [Italy]: Bertoncello artigrafiche, 2000.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Biblioteca Cicognara. Urbana, Ill.: Leopoldo Cicognara Program, University of Illinois Library, 1989.

Cicognara, Leopoldo. Stonra della scultura dal suo risorgzmento in Italia... 3 vols. Venice:Tip.

Cicognara, Leopoldo, Johann Joachim Winckelmann, and J. B. L. G. Seroux d'Agincourt. 1813. Storia della scultura dal suo risorgimento in Italia sino al secolo di Napoleone. Venezia: Picotti.
